page.title: 10WOODINGTON FARM
page.content:
Woodington Farm is one of the major farms in East Wellow and is farmed in conjunction with several other units. The farm itself is 485 acres in total with 268 acres under crops. The major crops grown are winter wheat, winter barley,spring barley and oil seed rape which is used for the making of margerine, and soap etc.. 106 acres is under grass. The farm operates a nine year rotation of which only two years are given to grass.
There is a considerable amount of livestock on the farm including 114 beef cattle and there are also pigs and chickens reared commercially. There are 14 people employed on the farm which is an unusually high number and of these only three are part-time. The main sources of income for the farm are cereals,pigs,eggs & chickens.
